page.title: 01Introduction
page.content: Ten out of our twelve square kilometres consist of farming units which is not surprising as this has traditionally been renowned as a highly fertile land area. Being at a latitude of 57 degrees north means that we have a fairly temperate climate with all year round rainfall which,in conjunction with good soil provides us with lush grass for grazing. With the introduction of early ripening varieties of cereals,farmers can now diversify and not be totally reliant on the produce of one aspect of farming. The remaining two square kilometres are largely occupied by relatively recent town development in the form of housing estates built on what was formerly farm land.
